description.p: Improve ImgSLI is a versatile open-source tool designed for detailed side-by-side image comparison. Easily spot differences and inspect fine details using its synchronized magnifying glass feature. Ideal for designers, photographers, AI art/upscaling enthusiasts, and anyone needing precise visual analysis.

ul.li: Compare images with an adjustable horizontal or vertical split line.
Use the powerful synchronized magnifier with flexible controls: adjustable capture/display size, position control (mouse and WASD/QE keys), view freezing, and combined magnifiers.
Load single or multiple images per comparison panel via drag-and-drop or file dialogs.
Easily switch between loaded images using dropdown selectors.
Save the complete comparison view (including split line, magnifier markers, and optional filenames) as a full-resolution image.
Swap image lists between panels with a single click.
Edit displayed file names directly within the interface.
Multi-language interface (English, Russian, Chinese, Brazilian Portuguese) with persistent settings.
Selectable interpolation methods for the magnifier (Nearest Neighbor, Bilinear, Bicubic, Lanczos).
Quick preview of individual images using Space + Mouse Buttons.

description.p: The application is intuitive and distributed under the free MIT License.
This update represents a strategic unification effort, bringing significant architectural improvements, powerful new workflow features, and a complete suite of image analysis tools.

ul.li: Shared Toolkit Integration: Complete integration with a shared component library enabling code reuse across projects and establishing a solid foundation for future development.

Clipboard Integration: Revolutionary workflow enhancement with full clipboard support! Paste images directly from your clipboard using Ctrl+V, with an intuitive direction selection overlay for choosing placement (left/right/both).

Professional Image Analysis Suite: A comprehensive set of visual comparison and analysis tools, including pixel difference highlighting, structural similarity mapping, edge detection, channel analysis, and metrics calculation (PSNR/SSIM).

Enhanced UX Customization: Complete redesign of visual customization options, allowing precise control over the comparison divider and magnifier separator (visibility, color, thickness). System notifications on Linux have been fixed.

Premium Magnifier Rendering: Subpixel precision controls ensure smooth, accurate comparisons even when images have different resolutions. The magnifier now intelligently adapts its rendering quality based on zoom levels and comparison modes.
Robust Multi-Platform Builds: Extensive DevOps work ensured stable cross-platform deployment, with thorough testing and debugging across Linux (AUR, Flatpak) and Windows build systems.

This is the most extensive architectural refactoring in the project's history, transitioning the entire application to a robust and modern Model-View-Presenter (MVP) pattern. This update establishes a new, stable foundation for future development and introduces a completely custom-built UI.
Complete Architectural Overhaul: The codebase is now fully modular and based on the MVP pattern, significantly improving stability and maintainability. Many underlying bugs have been passively fixed as a result.
New Custom UI: The third-party `PyQt-Fluent-Widgets` library has been removed and replaced with a custom-built set of "fluent-style" components. This removes GPL licensing constraints and gives the application a more unique design.
Enhanced Image List Management: The image selection flyout is now a powerful two-panel manager with full drag-and-drop support for reordering and moving images between lists.
New and Reimagined Dialogs: Introduced a dedicated, feature-rich Export dialog and a redesigned, easier-to-navigate Help window.
Improved Caching: The caching system has been upgraded from two to three levels for even smoother performance during interactive use.
Reduced Package Size: The removal of the external UI library has decreased the application's overall size on some platforms.
This is a major quality-of-life and rendering engine update.
Overhauled the core update logic to a reactive, state-driven architecture, significantly improving stability and eliminating a class of race-condition bugs.
The magnifier can now render outside the image boundaries and correctly handles horizontal split view.
Added smooth, anti-aliased borders for the magnifier and capture area for better visual quality.
Added long-press actions for swapping and clearing images/lists to speed up workflow.
Image selection dropdowns are now scrollable with the mouse wheel.
Added a new setting to permanently enable or disable debug logging.
Replaced all internal print statements with a structured logging system.
This release introduces a major user interface overhaul and performance improvements.
The application interface has been completely redesigned using the modern `qfluentwidgets` style.
The image caching service has been significantly improved, resulting in a much smoother experience.
Refactored the core rendering code for better performance and easier maintenance.
This release focuses on settings persistence and bug fixes.
Added window state persistence: the app now remembers its size and position between sessions.
Introduced a new Settings dialog to centralize application preferences.
Added options to configure UI language, JPEG save quality, and the maximum length of displayed filenames.
Addressed several critical bugs to improve stability.
